required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Eosinophilic Cystitis Mimicking Urothelial Neoplasia: A Retrospective Study

brief_summary.textblock: We explored the potential etiology, clinical and histopathology presentation of the eosinophilic cystitis cases, clinically mimicking urothelial neoplasia. Surgical procedure and clinical outcome also evaluated. T

detailed_description.textblock: A pooled 22 patients diagnosed with eosinophilic cystitis on microscopic examination in our hospital during four years were retrospectively studied.We explored the potential etiology, clinical and histopathology presentation of the eosinophilic cystitis cases, clinically mimicking urothelial neoplasia. Surgical procedure and clinical outcome also evaluated. Transurethral resection of the lesions were performed and pathologically examined, we re-examined the studied cases and made a clinical correlation.

primary_outcome.description: Each tissue slide is retrieved and examined to count the eosinphils in the submucosa, positive cases revelaed more than 90% eosinophils of the whole inflammatory cells

intervention.description: All the studies cases are microscopically examined using the ordinary stains (hematoxylin and eosin) then the eosinophilic infiltration are counted in 10 high power field manually

study_pop.textblock: Patients from Al-Azhar Hospital Urology outpatient and inpatient clinic during 4 years ftarting from January 2017

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Clinically suspected urothelial neoplasia
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients who did not complete the follow up period
